author: S Ganesan
text:
Close on the heels of the assault on Balan, a farmer in Thanjavur, a small farmer of Ariyalur district is reported to have committed suicide on Friday after his tractor was seized by a private finance company for defaulting on a loan taken for the vehicle.

According to police sources, Alagar (26), son of Arumugam, of Orathur near V.Kaikatti in the district had taken a loan of Rs.7 lakh for purchasing a tractor from a private finance company a few years back. He is said to have re-paid about Rs.5 lakh, but he did not pay remaining instalments.

On Thursday, a group of staff of the private finance company allegedly intercepted Alagar at V.Kaikatti and seized the tractor. Soon after the incident, Alagar consumed pesticide and was rushed to a hospital at Keezhapazhur where he died on Friday.

Police said no complaint was received and no case registered. The family is said to have cremated his body on Friday. They were unwilling to speak to the media.

Expressing concern over the suicide, Raja Chidambaram, State Secretary, Tamizhaga Vivasayigal Sangam, condemned harassment of farmers and seizure of the vehicles by banks and financial institutions. He demanded sanction of Rs.10 lakh as compensation to the family of the deceased. Stating that many farmers were facing problems repaying loans obtained for tractors at high interest rates, he urged the Centre to extend soft loans to farmers. “All farm loans should be extended at four per cent simple interest and only then can such suicides be averted,” he said. Suicide prevention helplines are available: the government (104), and Sneha, an NGO (044 24640050).
title: Farmer commits suicide after financiers seize tractor
